titleproper.value:
Guide to the Elizabeth Keegin Colley Photographs of Prospect Park
                    <lb/>2007-2009
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 357</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2018-03-23T10:39-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Elizabeth Keegin Colley photographs of Prospect Park

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The collection includes eighteen color photographs of Prospect Park, Brooklyn, New York, by Elizabeth Keegin Colley. The images were included in the book 
                <emph render="italic">Prospect Park: Olmsted & Vaux's Brooklyn Masterpiece</emph>, which was written by her husband, David P. Colley. Images include the Long Meadow, Vale of Cashmere, Meadowport Arch, and other features of the park.

p.value: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.
Gift from the photographer, Elizabeth Keegin Colley, September 2014.

(For further information, see the Brownstoner's 2013 
                <extref ns2:actuate="onRequest" ns2:href="https://www.brownstoner.com/brooklyn-life/the-hot-seat-david-p-colley-and-elizabeth-keegin-colley/">on-line interview</extref> with the Colleys.)

The photographs are pigment inkjet on archival paper, printed from digital images. The images are printed on sixteen sheets (two sheets include two images each), measuring about 25" x 17". Some of these photographs can be viewed on 
                <extref ns2:actuate="onRequest" ns2:href="https://elizabethcolley.photoshelter.com/gallery/Prospect-Park-Brooklyn/G00000_qcsVBvjTc/">Colley's website</extref>.
